data.title: Sprite.RegionRect doesn't display its value in editor
data.body:
Mac OSX 10.10.3. Godot 2.0 release version.

Sprite.RegionRect doesn't display its value in editor. The panel editor displays 0,0,0,0 and when you click on it to edit it it displays 0,0,50,50

I was following the TileSet tutorial and so I did this:
1) Created a Node
2) Added a Sprite to it. Renamed the sprite and saved the Scene
3) Although not mentioned in the tutorial I clicked the Sprite Region Editor button and selected the first tile (wall) located at 0,0,50,50
4) Changed the Sprite.Region value to "on". Editor reflects correctly the change and only wall was visible.
5) My surprise was that RegionRect seems to not change from 0,0,0,0

![sprite regionrectbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/346755/13388699/842283d4-dec2-11e5-841c-fa2091465e86.png)

data.title: Fix crash with release mode
data.body:
We have to shift log(num of bits) many times not num of bytes many.

In some cases, like for example for size_t on 64 bit builds, the number of bytes (8 here) can become larger than ilog(num bits) (6 here).

This will cause undefined behaviour when `1 << i` becomes larger than or equal to the number of bits in T. In this case the behaviour resulted in x becoming 2^64-1 and thus 0 when the function returned. This causes an allocation of size 0 later on.

data.title: Shader Time in Android
data.body:
I write a water shader for my game I used TIME to pan around the shader , it was doing ok in pc ,linux ,osx but when I export it to android after a few minutes the shader movement was lagging but my fps was 60  I wrote a uniform for time and used it instead of TIME and  in gdscript I set the time uniform in _process func  , but after afew minutes I saw the lag again. so I wrote it this way

```
 var time =0
 func _process(delta):
    time+=delta
    set_shader_time(time) 
    if time > 10 :
       time = 0 
```

I suspect the problem is that after sometime the TIME variable in shader becomes too large to handle.
I will support a test project.

data.title: Expose real-time amplitude processing to GDscript
Proposal for looping and audio sample default behavior.
data.body:
Right now to loop the sample two steps need to be taken now:
1. setting the loop at import sound setting
2. setting Loop Format, Loop Begin and Loop End at SampleLibrary sample edit properties Indicator panel.

It is not intuitive at all. Most new users probably expect that after the first step (setting the loop during sample import), the sample will be already looped and will play from the very start to the very end and again. After all they set it to be looped, right?
It would be better if, after checking the loop option in sample import settings, the sample by default be set to Loop Format = Forward, Loop Begin = 0, Loop End = 1000000000. It's what is expected most of the times as a sound loop.
Of course other settings and their editing should still be available in Inspector after pressing the pencil icon in SampleLibrary, if someone wants to change anything.

data.title: Can no longer instantiate subclasses
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Arch Linux

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I get an "Invalid call. Nonexistent function 'new' in base 'GDScript'." error when I attempt to instantiate a subclass defined within a class file.  This has worked in the past and broke within the last week in master.

Example:

``` python
var Bar = preload("Bar.gd")

class Foo:
    var x = 0
    func new(y):
        x = y


func _ready():
    # This works
    var bar = Bar.new(1)

    # This does not work
    var foo = Foo.new(1)

```

**Steps to reproduce:**
I provided a simple sample project.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[SubclassTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/150203/SubclassTest.zip)

data.title: Long code hints do not fit in editor window
data.body:
When typing a parameters for a function with many parameters, the hint/tooltip that's displayed may sometimes appear way to the right and end up under the Inspector window as seen in the attached screenshot.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/755062/13382433/54ac0f72-de53-11e5-9259-ee84b64c06c6.png)

data.title: Text editor extensions for the plugins API
data.body:
It'd be nice to be able to add behaviour that we've grown to love from other editors in plugins, such as "zen coding", highlighting of all occurences of the currently selected word, etc.

I'm not entirely sure what the best approach for coding such features would be (perhaps it'd be worth it to take a look at how Brackets.io plugins are coded), but I'm guessing we'd need all kinds of access to the text editor window..

Apoligies for being too vague (and/or if such access is already available).

data.title: Label: get_visible_line_count() method
data.body:
This is a feature request, in tandem with #3854, for the same reasons.

This is required because Label's get_line_count() returns the _total_ number of lines, not the number of actually visible lines.

data.title: Script Editor word highlighting
data.body:
This is a small feature wish for the script editor and may be open for discussion.

When navigating through longer scripts and searching for special variables I found a certain feature extremely helpfull in other scripting editors.
If I mark a word (be it a variable name, or value or object) the scripteditor also marks the same word in the whole editor. This makes it supereasy to look for variables that are also used in other places. And I think this could be something that is not very hard to add.

What do you think of such feature? I think this is a small enhancement which can make life a lot easier :)

data.title: Projects removed from project manager if their drive is not mounted
data.body:
I think this is a small issue.
Following problem.
I have some projects that I store on my usb stick. So I import them in godot and everything works fine.

If the usb stick is plugged in and I start godot the project is listed.
Now here comes the problem. If my usb stick is not plugged in and I start godot the project is of course not listed. But it seems it then gets completely removed from the list. Even if I plug the stick to my computer and then restart godot the project is gone and I have to add it again manually. This is a bit annoying.
Would be good if that project is still stored. Even if the usb stick is not plugged in.

data.title: Adds EditorPlugin::remove_control_from_bottom_panel()
data.body:
Also renames `add_control_to_bottom_dock` to `add_control_to_bottom_panel` so that it would be clear that the removal functions are different too.

This was done as adding and then removing plugins using the bottom panel/dock would not clean up properly.

data.title: Document Tween class
data.body:
This PR add documentation for the `Tween` class to `doc/base/classes.xml`.

Note that the codeblock I added suffers from #3861 :smile:

data.title: [codeblock]s in description tags in classes.xml show badly in editor help
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**

Linux 64 bit, shouldn't matter.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

In short, `[codeblock]` constructions in class description show on just one line.

When writing a description about `Tween`s in `classes.xml`, I decided I should add a code example **to the class itself**, like so:

```
    <description>
    Node useful for animations with unknown start and end points, procedural animations, making one node follow another, and other simple behavior.

    Because it is easy to get it wrong, here is a quick usage example:

    [codeblock]
    var tween = get_node("Tween")
    tween.interpolate_property(get_node("Node2D_to_move"), "transform/pos", Vector2(0,0), Vector2(100,100), Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN_OUT)
    tween.start()
    [/codeblock]
    </description>
```

Unfortunately, in-editor this shows on a single line:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/13379740/cad98dd6-de36-11e5-9040-9142e6039285.png)

I tried to double the newlines in the code as well, but then it would become new paragraphs (and looks even worse).

**Steps to reproduce:**

Copy-paste the example from above.

data.title: Augmented Reality support for Godot
data.body:
This is a very broad feature request encompassing some or most of these features:
- Video Camera Capture
- Object Recognition (likely OpenCV via haar)
- or some other form of AR Card contextual shape recognition
- Motion Tracking
- Mobile devices sensors support
- GPS Tracking

Likely 3.0 or later if at all desired for Godot Engine. AR Games are getting more popular so would be quite nice to have out of the box AR support for Godot Engine.

data.title: From GitHub HEAD: Custom-node addon crashing Godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
LinuxMint 64bit, Godot.x11 Editor.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The Editor wouldn't update the Nodes list after enabling/disabling the "Heart" addon example; if you add the Node after it was disabled, the Engine will crash. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
To check on Node list update:
1- Enabling "custom_node" plugin on the addon list.
2- Click on "Add/Create a new Node"
The node won't appear on the Node List, unless you search for "Heart" node. Than it will show properly on the list.
The inverse thing will happen when you disable the Addon; it will stay appearing on the list, unless you search for him (than it won't show anymore).

To crash the Editor:
1- Enable "custom_node" plugin on the addon list
2- Disable "custom_node" plugin on the addon list
3- Enable "custom_node" plugin on the addon list
4- Add the "Heart" node to the scene.
The editor will crash; restarting it will have "Heart" Addon enabled.

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer (Blend3): process all inputs.
data.body:
Always call _process_node on all three inputs so that looped animations
don't get out of sync.

We're using this to blend idle/walk/run cycles, and after blending back and forth the walk/run would no longer be lined up, so sometimes they would fight with each other and the legs would barely be moving.

Looks like all the other blend nodes are fine...

data.title: Globals GUI not working propperly
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 7 x64

Using either Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_win64.exe or Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_win32.exe

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
There are a few of strange issues when trying to add/edit globals (see steps).

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create and open a new project in the editor.
2. Add any node as root
3. Open Scene/Project Settings/Global
4. Add a new global variable "foo" of any kind -> popup's view is set to "Application" settings for some reason
5. Enter some value for the propperty and press enter (or simply click to check the box if it's boolean) -> propperty appears to be duplicated

data.title: Editor crash on save if root node is TextureProgress on win64
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 7 x64

Using Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_win64.exe (not reproducible in same PC if using Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_win32.exe)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The editor doesn't seem able to save a scene with only a TextureProgress as it's root node.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open editor
2. Create and open new project
3. Add a TextureProgress
4. Attempt to save the scene -> editor crashes

data.title: RichTextLabel: a method to get the number of visible lines
data.body:
This is a feature request for RichTextLabel. Currently, RichTextLabel only offers to set/get the number of visible characters, but it does not offer how many lines are visible. As far as I see, this is not possible to calculate in GDScript when the font is a not a fixed-width one.
### Context:

The way RichTextLabel handles long texts (scrollbars) is useful when building desktop-like GUIs, but many games (Visual Novels, JRPGs) don't work that way.

I'm trying to implement a text box for dialogue. Typically, a a text box has a fixed width and fixed number of lines visible, so a long text that doesn't fit into the text box is broken into parts (each part contains only enough characters to fill the textbox), and the next part is not shown until the user presses a button.

I essentially need to implement something along the lines of [this](https://github.com/henriquelalves/GodotTIE), but I need to use RichTextLabel for italics and bold, and the font isn't a fixed width one. A way to obtain the number of visible lines will enable implemention.

data.title: Exported Release application shows Godot Engine Editor (alpha)
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Operating system or device:
Windows 10 host, Windows Desktop export with all variants 32/64/Debug/Release
Export template: Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_export_templates.tpz

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The exported application name in Windows 10 Task Manager shows up as:
Godot Enginer Editor (alpha), and contains the default Godot icon. The actual application name shows up as a subprocess and contains the actual application icon.

Expected that there would not be a parent process or that it would be named after the project name. Most importantly that it wouldn't say "Editor (alpha)"

This may be related to #3686, however that issue specifically calls out the name of the console window, which doesn't apply to release builds like this issue does. Still the source of the "alpha" name is likely the same.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Export project and run it on Windows 10 platform, look for the process in Task Manager

data.title: Exported custom Application Icon not working
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 10 host, Windows Desktop export with all variants 32/64/Debug/Release
Export template: Godot_v2.0_stable_20160223_export_templates.tpz

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
A custom icon was selected, original icon.png was removed from project. The project shows the correct icon in Project Manager window, but when exported the application icon is the default Godot icon.

Update 2/27: This likely relates to #3853 indirectly. It appears that exported Godot applications run as a subprocess of "Godot Engine Editor" process. The application icon that is shown is probably the icon of the parent process. I've noticed that in Windows Task Manager listing the subprocess has the correct icon.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Pick custom icon, export windows project

data.title: Export resources without dependencies
data.body:
I was thinking the option of exporting without dependencies should be implemented.
I wanted to have to .pcks one with hd res and another with sd res. Now let's say the game is put together with an hd res. if i try to export a pck with only the sd stuff(and the appropriate script to load the right texture given the context), the pck export actually has both the hd -and sd versions defeating the purpose of such, because the hd versions are considered a dependency.

Generally having full control over your project is beneficial, so i don't see why not.
Along with the option of selecting folders and not only files on export(which i already mentioned on another feature request), i think this one would further optimize the exporting system.
In fact my suggestion is that "include dependencies" should be a checkbox in the "export selected resources" tab.

data.title: Gridmap don't bake it's geometry even if 'bake' is checked.
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Ubuntu linux 15.10 64bit, Godot 2.0 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Gridmap is not baking it's geometry automatically even if Octant Size is bigger than 1 and "Bake" is checked. This results with extraordinary number of draw calls (like hundreds when only a couple of tiles is visible <- depending on what octant size is).
_**Note that it's easy to workaround this, just run `bake_geometry();` on GridMap in ready**_

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download sample project
2. Run it and observe a lot of draw calls (a lot more then number of visible tiles).
3. Open Main.gd script and uncomment manual baking in ready.
4. Run the project and observe small amount of draw calls
5. Also please take a look at sample movie and pay attention to how number of  draw calls is drastically changing when we play with octant size without baking geometry manually (despite the fact that there are always only 4 visible tiles on the scene).

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Video that illustrates the problem: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ryM_0ObAQsM&feature=youtu.be
Sample project: [GridMapBakeGeometryProblem.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/149354/GridMapBakeGeometryProblem.zip)

data.title: Extraordinary number of drawcalls with OmniLight, shadow and Gridmap
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Ubuntu linux 15.10 64bit, Godot 2.0 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
There is something wrong with gridmap and shadows. Basically if I have a large gridmap and I put very small omni light on the scene (with radius of 1.5 tile size) I have normal nmb of draw calls (for not baked gridmap it's amount of visible tiles). 
When I turn on the shadow property on the light I will get amount of drawcalls similar to overall number of tiles (instead of 4, lets say 300). 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Short way:
1. Download sample project.
2. Find OmniLight inside Camera node
3. Run the project with shadow ON, observe nmb of draw calls 
4. Run the project with shadow OFF, observe nmb of draw calls 
5. (optional) You can play with live editing and moving camera around.

Manual way:
1. Prepare gridmap setup (mesh library + big gridmap lvl)
2. Add camera and omni light (the best setup would be ideal topdown so you could exactly see light boundaries and what's rendered on the screen)
3. Note normal number of draw calls.
4. Turn on shadow on Omni light
5. Observe extraordinary number of draw calls.

**Link to minimal example project** 
Video that ilustrates the bug: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1YANlODPa54&feature=youtu.be
Sample project: [Grid_and_Shadows Draw_cal_ Issue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/149351/Grid_and_Shadows.Draw_cal_.Issue.zip)

data.title: Improving the official Godot icon
data.body:
Our current official "square" icon, which is used e.g. on Steam and could be used by distro packagers, was contributed as part of the pe_bliss integration:
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/godot_icon.svg
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/godot_icon.png

I already expressed back then that I was not fond of the "app-like" capsule, and now I also find that the grey background does not look so great.

So I'm looking for feedback on how to improve it. Godot as an official visual identity so the Godot "logo" itself should not be modified (it should stay this nice little blue robot/ogre head), but the background could be removed/enhanced.

My proposal would be to just drop this background and just keep the Godot logo as official icon, with a transparency layer. Or if people like the capsule-shaped background, I'd go for a much whiter grey than the current one, which does not fit Godot's blue at all.

Note that this icon is meant to be used in very small resolutions (32x32 px for example), so contrast is very important.

data.title: 3D Path - please add "select control point" button
data.body: path in 3D does not have select control point button. but it's handled by shift drag
